text.p: Josephthal Lyon & Ross raised its six-month price target for Tecnomatix Technologies Inc to $43 a share and said it expects the company to meet or exceed its second-quarter earnings estimate.
Josephthal also raised its earnings per share (EPS) estimate for 1997 to $1.09 from $1.07 and for 1998 to $1.42 from $1.40. In 1996 the Israeli company earned $0.82.
"During recent weeks shares of Tecnomatix have consistently remained within our price target range of $30-$35," analyst Abraham Finklestein said in a report.
The shares are currently at $37-3/8, up over 20 percent in the past month alone.
Josephthal estimates the company will report second-quarter EPS of $0.24 on July 23, in line with the consensus projection. In the same quarter last year it earned $0.19.
"Our belief that an opportunity exists to surpass these estimates relates to the recent devaluation of the new Israeli shekel," the report said.

Finklestein also said the company's shares now trade at a higher multiple to earnings. "We attribute the multiple expansion to increasing confidence in Tecnomatix's ability to sustain its revenue growth rate, and more importantly, achieve earnings estimates," the report said.
